captions.text: >> I would say it was about threee months ago, they were picked up by Animal Services in Osteen,
they were abandoned at the end of someone's driveway, they were picked up and taken to Animal Control, and they were pretty much inseperable.
They were found together, and the Dachshund absolutely loves this kitten.
The kitten has some health issues, obviously.
We named them Idgie and Ruth after "Fried Green Tomatoes," because of the special bond they have.
We've had bonds between animals, I don't know that we've seen anything quite like this, with a cat and a dog,
I know that it does happen, but this is pretty special.
When Idgie gets a new toy, she always takes it over to the cat, and they pretty much share everything,
and anytime that there's a dog that comes in, Ruthie is always first there on the scene to make sure
that she's the buffer between any dog and the cat, of course, they're in the pen during the day, so there's no threat to Ruth.
We do adoptions through Animal Services, we've been doing it since 2007, we also do adoptions through other rescue groups,
so when they have something that requires a little extra attention, it's not uncommon for them to give us a call.
We've adopted them here ourselves at Hollywood Hounds, and they get lots of attention, so we're making up for lost time
of anything they may have lacked.
We like to say they have about 14 mommies here,
everytime Idgie goes out, she gets a smooch,
someone's constantly babying Ruth, and so it's a lot of attention, almost around the clock.
Customers come in just to see them, to pet them.
We've had customers bring them Christmas gifts, it's just been very touching.

title: Abandoned dog bonds with paralyzed cat

comments.author: GoryBlueCat

comments.text:
this is how we got our dog Harley, about December 17th in 2008 we were 
coming home from my grandparents and my little sister and myself were in 
the back seat and thought we saw a rabbit in the snow, a few seconds later 
we had pulled over once my mom realized it was an abandoned dog, she had no 
collar, she was all skin and bones and was terrified, i ran out and picked 
her up quickly hopping in the car (to my stepfathers displeasure, since he 
didn't want "the mangy mutt") and i took her home with us and she's been 
part of the family ever since, the vet said she had been beaten and starved 
for a long time before we found her but now she's a plump little ball of 
energy, flying all around the house, howling and terrorizing the cat, sadly 
she has tumors on her stomach and sides but we love her all the same and 
she's enjoyed a long healthy life so far﻿

comments.text:
Deutsch: Ausgesetzter Hund (Dackel) freundet sich mit gelähmter Katze an!
Francais: Chien abandonné (Basset des Alpes) se lie d'amitié avec Chat 
paralysé!
Italiano: Cane abbandonato (Bassotto) fa amicizia con gatto paralizzato!
Espanol: Perro abandonado (el Dachshund) hace amigo con el gato paralizado!
Portugueses: Cão abandonado (o Dachshund) faz amizade com o gato paralisado!

English:
Addendum to: Abandoned Dachshund befriends with paralyzed Cat
A further proof of the animal kingdom which more than proves what animals 
have a sense and check exactly: "Hey, there's one where it is possibly even 
worse than me and sure like to have a new friend as we can." Humans "us so 
well adopt some and above all learn some of it!

Deutsch:
Nachtrag zu Ausgesetzter Dackel freundet sich mit gelähmter Katze an:
Eine weiterer Beweis aus der Reich der Tiere welcher mehr als beweist, was 
Tiere für ein Gespür haben und ganz genau checken: "Hey, da ist einer dem 
es möglicherweise noch schlechter geht als mir und sicher gerne einen neuen 
Freund hätte. Da können wir "Menschen" uns noch so einiges abschauen und 
vor allem davon lernen!﻿

comments.author: InsanelyGeekStudios

comments.text:
It looks like the main problem with the front paws is proprioception (a 
sense of where in space the limbs are). You can see she just has to move 
her paws a few times to get them placed correctly, and then they work fine. 
It's similar to if you have a hand or foot that is asleep enough to not 
quite feel where it is. She can probably use the litter box, but may make 
more of a mess and need to be helped to clean herself up. I bet Idgie helps 
clean her. They were adopted by the shelter, so that is their forever home.
comments.author: Ambyrhawke Shadowsinger
